alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Petroleum (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 11:44PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Petroleum and Garfield Counties through 1245 AM MDT... At 1144 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Mosby, or 30 miles east of Winnett, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jordan, Winnett, Sand Springs, Crooked Creek Rec Area, Hillside, Flatwillow, Edwards, Cohagen, Mosby, Brusett, Petrolia Lake, Van Norman, Steve Fork, Tiegen, and Cat Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
